channel.title: Comments on: Going With The Old Reader

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/06/25/going-with-the-old-reader/#comment-4072">Thomas</a>.
I don't know, I haven't tried changing the title of a feed in The Old Reader.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Thomas.

I don’t know, I haven’t tried changing the title of a feed in The Old Reader.

item.title: By: Thomas
item.dc:creator: Thomas
item.description: I went with The Old Reader as well. Could it be correct that I can't change the title of a feed?
item.content:encoded:
I went with The Old Reader as well.
Could it be correct that I can’t change the title of a feed?

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/06/25/going-with-the-old-reader/#comment-4070">Shea Bunge</a>.
I don't use the title only view, I quickly skim through the whole post view.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Shea Bunge.

I don’t use the title only view, I quickly skim through the whole post view.

item.title: By: Shea Bunge
item.dc:creator: Shea Bunge
item.description: I had a look at The Old Reader, but decided on Feedly instead. I'm slowly adapting to the slightly different reading style, but it's not <em>that</em> much of a change; they provide a title-only view very similar to Google Reader. The lack of an export option is a worry however, but I think I heard that they'll be adding this in soon.
item.content:encoded: I had a look at The Old Reader, but decided on Feedly instead. I’m slowly adapting to the slightly different reading style, but it’s not that much of a change; they provide a title-only view very similar to Google Reader. The lack of an export option is a worry however, but I think I heard that they’ll be adding this in soon.
